definition: abbr. for 勞動改造|劳动改造[lao2 dong4 gai3 zao4]/reform through labor/laogai (prison camp)
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)

sentences.english: When the war ended, he was sent to a re-education camp.
sentences.chinese: 当战争结束，他被送到了劳改营。

sentences.english: The Xiangride Prison Farm south of Dulan at one time had 100,000 prisoners.
sentences.chinese: 都兰南部的香日德劳改营曾一度关有囚犯十万人。

sentences.english: A prisoner picked up 1,000yuan in the course of building the road outside the prison.
sentences.chinese: 一个劳改犯人在监狱外修路的时候捡到1000元。

sentences.english: Each city and province maintains its own camp.
sentences.chinese: 各省市都有自己的劳改营地。

sentences.english: Richard got a light sentence and was sent to a cherry farm for six months.
sentences.chinese: 理查德判了轻刑，被送到劳改农场服劳役六个月。

sentences.english: The prisoners missing from the meeting were picked up within48 hours.
sentences.chinese: 开会时不见了的劳改犯在48小时之内被抓获了。

sentences.english: The prisoners who had missed from the place of reform through labour were picked up within 24 hours.
sentences.chinese: 从劳改场所逃走的囚犯在24小时之内被捉到了。

sentences.english: His wife, Anna Larina, was sent to a labor camp , but survived.
sentences.chinese: 他的妻子被关入劳改营，但是幸存。

sentences.english: China prohibits export of products made with prison labour.
sentences.chinese: 中国禁止劳改产品出口。

sentences.english: Each city and province maintains its own camp .
sentences.chinese: 各省市都有自己的劳改营地。

sentences.english: The reform of criminals through persuasion by reform- through-labour institutions has received a sincere response from most prisoners.
sentences.chinese: 劳改机关对罪犯的感化，得到了多数罪犯真诚的响应。

sentences.english: We feared that at any moment we could be sent to a hard labour camp.
sentences.chinese: 我们害怕不知道什么时候就会被送去劳改营。

definition: to drag sb before a public meeting to denounce, humiliate and physically abuse them (esp. during the Cultural Revolution)
capitalist roader (person in power taking the capitalist road, a political label often pinned on cadres by the Red Guards during the Cultural Revolution)
May 7 Cadre School (forcing educated people into re-education and peasant labor during Cultural Revolution)/abbr. for 五七幹部學校|五七干部学校[wu3 qi1 gan4 bu4 xue2 xiao4]
Cultural Revolution (1966-76)/abbr. for 文化大革命[Wen2 hua4 Da4 ge2 ming4]
to send away to serve a penal sentence
